trans-unit.source: Represents a field that displays navigation controls in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control enable users to page through data.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField> class represents a field that displays navigation controls in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control.

These navigation controls can be used to page through data that are displayed by a control that implements the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IPageableItemContainer> interface, such as the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField> class provides buttons that enable users to navigate through the pages of data one page at a time, or to jump to the first or last page of data.

You can customize the appearance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField> object by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.ButtonCssClass%2A> property to set the style of the buttons.
You can also use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.ButtonType%2A> property to choose the type of button that is displayed.
The following table lists the available button types.
Button type
Description
A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Button> control.
An <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageButton> control.
A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinkButton> control.

You can hide a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField> object in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.Visible%2A> property to `false`.

You can also hide the individual buttons (the first-page, previous-page, next-page, and last-page buttons) by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.ShowFirstPageButton%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.ShowPreviousPageButton%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.ShowNextPageButton%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.ShowLastPageButton%2A> properties to `false`.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField> control enables you to specify custom text for each button by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.FirstPageText%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.PreviousPageText%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.NextPageText%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.LastPageText%2A> properties.
When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.ButtonType%2A> property is set to `ButtonType.Image`, you must provide the URL to an image that will be displayed for the button.

You can set images individually for each button by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.FirstPageImageUrl%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.PreviousPageImageUrl%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.NextPageImageUrl%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.LastPageImageUrl%2A> properties.
When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.ButtonType%2A> property is set to `ButtonType.Image`, the corresponding text property acts as the alternate text for the image.
For example, the text that is specified by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.FirstPageText%2A> property is displayed as the alternate text for the first-page image button.
In browsers that support tooltips, this text is also displayed as a tooltip.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField"></xref> class.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.%23ctor%2A> constructor to initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField> class.
This constructor is typically used when you are adding fields to a dynamically created <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control.

To add a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField> object dynamically to a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control, create a new <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField> object, set its properties, and then add it to the field collection for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control.
Gets or sets the cascading style sheet (CSS) class that is used to render the buttons of the pager field on the browser.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.ButtonCssClass%2A> property to specify the CSS class to render on the browser for the buttons of the pager field.
This property will always be rendered as the class attribute, regardless of the browser.
On browsers that do not support CSS, setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.ButtonCssClass%2A> property has no effect.
The value of this property is stored in viewstate.
The CSS class used to render the buttons of the pager field on the client.
The default is an empty string, which indicates that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.ButtonCssClass"></xref> property is not set.
Gets or sets the button type to display in the pager field.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.ButtonType%2A> property to specify which type of button is displayed in a button field.
The following table lists the available button types.
Button type value
Description
A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Button> control.
An <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageButton> control.
A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinkButton> control.

When <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.ButtonType%2A> is set to `ButtonType.Image`, you must set the image to display for the buttons by using the properties shown in the following table.
Property
Description
The URL to an image to display for the first-page button.
The URL to an image to display for the previous-page button.
The URL to an image to display for the next-page button.
The URL to an image to display for the last-page button.
The value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.ButtonType%2A> property is stored in viewstate.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ButtonType"></xref> values.
The default is `ButtonType.Link`.
The value for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.ButtonType"></xref> property is not one of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ButtonType"></xref> values.

Copies the properties of the current <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField"></xref> object to the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref> object.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.CopyProperties%2A> method is a helper method.

It is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.CloneField%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to copy the properties of the current <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField> object to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> object that is passed in the `newField` parameter.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref> to copy the properties of the current <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField"></xref> to.
Creates the user interface (UI) controls for the pager field object and adds them to the specified container.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.CreateDataPagers%2A> method is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.CreatePagerFields%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to create the UI controls for the pager field, such as the Previous and Next buttons.
The container that is used to store the controls.
The index of the first record on the page.
The maximum number of items on a single page.
The total number of items.
The index of the data pager field in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.Fields"></xref> collection.
Creates and returns a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField"></xref> class.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.CreateField%2A> method is a helper method that is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.CloneField%2A> method of the base class to create an empty <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField> object.
A new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField"></xref> class.
Determines whether the specified object is equal to the current <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField"></xref> object.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.Equals%2A> method to determine whether the current <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField> object is equal to the object that is specified by the `o` parameter.

<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.Equals%2A> returns `true` if the two objects contain exactly the same values for all public properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField> class.
The object to compare with the current <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField"></xref> instance.
`true` if the specified object is equal to the current <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField"></xref> object; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the URL to an image that is displayed for the first-page button.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.ButtonType%2A> property is set to `ButtonType.Image` and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.ShowFirstPageButton%2A> property is set to `true`, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.FirstPageImageUrl%2A> property to specify the URL to an image that is displayed for the first-page button.
This image can be in any file format (.jpg, .gif, .bmp, and so on) that is supported in the browser.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.ButtonType%2A> property is set to a value other than `ButtonType.Image`, setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.FirstPageImageUrl%2A> property has no effect.
The value of this property is stored in viewstate.
The URL to an image that is displayed for the first-page button.
The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.FirstPageImageUrl"></xref> property is not set.
Gets or sets the text that is displayed for the first-page button.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.ShowFirstPageButton%2A> property is set to `true`, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.FirstPageText%2A> property to specify the text to display for the first-page button.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.ButtonType%2A> property is set to `ButtonType.Image`, the image is displayed and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.FirstPageText%2A> property acts as the alternate text for the image.
On browsers that support tooltips, this text is also displayed as a tooltip.
The value of this property is stored in viewstate, and it can be saved automatically to a resource file by using a designer tool.
For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.LocalizableAttribute> and [Globalization and Localization](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/8ef3838e-9d05-4236-9dd0-ceecff9df80d).
The text that is displayed for the first-page button.
The default is "First".
Serves as a hash function for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField"></xref> class.
A hash code for the current <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField"></xref> object.
Handles events that occur in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField"></xref> control and performs the appropriate action.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.HandleEvent%2A> method is a helper method that is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.OnBubbleEvent%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
It is called to handle events that occur in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField> object when one of the buttons inside the control is clicked.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.HandleEvent%2A> method examines the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs.CommandName%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs> object that is contained in the `e` parameter, and then performs the appropriate action.
The following table lists the buttons that are provided by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField> control and the action that is performed when the button is clicked.
Button
CommandName value
Action
First page
Navigates to the first page of data.
Previous page
Navigates to the previous page of data.
Next page
Navigates to the next page of data.
Last page
Navigates to the last page of data.
The event data.
Gets or sets the URL to an image that is displayed for the last-page button in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField"></xref> object.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.ButtonType%2A> property is set to `ButtonType.Image` and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.ShowLastPageButton%2A> property is set to `true`, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.LastPageImageUrl%2A> property to specify the URL to an image that is displayed for the last-page button.
This image can be in any file format (.jpg, .gif, .bmp, and so on) that is supported in the browser.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.ButtonType%2A> property is set to a value other than `ButtonType.Image`, setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.LastPageImageUrl%2A> property has no effect.
The value of this property is stored in viewstate.
The URL to an image that is displayed for the last-page button in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField"></xref> object.
The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.LastPageImageUrl"></xref> property is not set.
Gets or sets the text that is displayed for the last-page button.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.ShowLastPageButton%2A> property is set to `true`, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.LastPageText%2A> property to specify the text to display for the last-page button.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.ButtonType%2A> property is set to `ButtonType.Image`, the image is displayed and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.LastPageText%2A> property acts as the alternate text for the image.
On browsers that support tooltips, this text is also displayed as a tooltip.
The value of this property is stored in viewstate, and it can be saved automatically to a resource file by using a designer tool.
For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.LocalizableAttribute> and [Globalization and Localization](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/8ef3838e-9d05-4236-9dd0-ceecff9df80d).
The text that is displayed for the last-page button.
The default is "Last".
Gets or sets the URL to an image that is displayed for the next-page button in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField"></xref> object.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.ButtonType%2A> property is set to `ButtonType.Image` and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.ShowNextPageButton%2A> property is set to `true`, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.NextPageImageUrl%2A> property to specify the URL to an image that is displayed for the next-page button.
This image can be in any file format (.jpg, .gif, .bmp, and so on) that is supported in the browser.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.ButtonType%2A> property is set to a value other than `ButtonType.Image`, setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.NextPageImageUrl%2A> property has no effect.
The value of this property is stored in viewstate.
The URL to an image that is displayed for the next-page button in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField"></xref> object.
The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.NextPageImageUrl"></xref> property is not set.
Gets or sets the text that is displayed for the next-page button.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.ShowNextPageButton%2A> property is set to `true`, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.NextPageText%2A> property to specify the text to display for the next-page button.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.ButtonType%2A> property is set to `ButtonType.Image`, the image is displayed and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.NextPageText%2A> property acts as the alternate text for the image.
On browsers that support tooltips, this text is also displayed as a tooltip.
The value of this property is stored in viewstate, and it can be saved automatically to a resource file by using a designer tool.
For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.LocalizableAttribute> and [Globalization and Localization](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/8ef3838e-9d05-4236-9dd0-ceecff9df80d).
The text that is displayed for the next-page button.
The default is "Next".
Gets or sets the URL to an image that is displayed for the previous-page button in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField"></xref> object.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.ButtonType%2A> property is set to `ButtonType.Image` and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.ShowPreviousPageButton%2A> property is set to `true`, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.PreviousPageImageUrl%2A> property to specify the URL to an image that is displayed for the previous-page button.
This image can be in any file format (.jpg, .gif, .bmp, and so on) that is supported in the browser.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.ButtonType%2A> property is set to a value other than `ButtonType.Image`, setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.PreviousPageImageUrl%2A> property has no effect.
The value of this property is stored in viewstate.
The URL to an image that is displayed for the previous-page button in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField"></xref> object.
The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.PreviousPageImageUrl"></xref> property is not set.
Gets or sets the text that is displayed for the previous-page button.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.ShowPreviousPageButton%2A> property is set to `true`, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.PreviousPageText%2A> property to specify the text to display for the previous-page button.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.ButtonType%2A> property is set to `ButtonType.Image`, the image is displayed and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.PreviousPageText%2A> property acts as the alternate text for the image.
On browsers that support tooltips, this text is also displayed as a tooltip.
The value of this property is stored in viewstate, and it can be saved automatically to a resource file by using a designer tool.
For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.LocalizableAttribute> and [Globalization and Localization](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/8ef3838e-9d05-4236-9dd0-ceecff9df80d).
The text that is displayed for the previous-page button.
The default is "Previous".

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether disabled buttons are rendered as <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Label"></xref> controls by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField"></xref> object.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.RenderDisabledButtonsAsLabels%2A> property to specify whether disabled buttons are rendered as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Label> controls by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField> object.
The buttons are disabled by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField> object when the function associated with the button cannot be performed.
For example, when you are in the first page of data, the first-page and previous-page buttons are disabled.

By default, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField> object renders the disabled buttons by using the control type specified by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.ButtonType%2A> property.
It also sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.Enabled%2A> property of the control to `false`.

When <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.RenderDisabledButtonsAsLabels%2A> is set to `true`, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField> object uses the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Label> control to render the disabled buttons.

The value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.ButtonCssClass%2A> property is used to set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.CssClass%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Label> control.
The value of this property is stored in viewstate.
`true` if disabled buttons are rendered as <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Label"></xref> controls; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether non-breaking spaces are rendered between controls.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.RenderNonBreakingSpacesBetweenControls%2A> property to specify whether non-breaking spaces (the HTML ` ` character) are rendered between the navigation controls of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField> object.

You can set <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.RenderNonBreakingSpacesBetweenControls%2A> to `false` if you need more control over the layout that you are creating with cascading style sheet (CSS) classes.
The value of this property is stored in viewstate.
`true` if non-breaking spaces are rendered between controls; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the first-page button is displayed in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField"></xref> object.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.ShowFirstPageButton%2A> property to show or hide the first-page button of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField> object.
To show the first-page button, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.ShowFirstPageButton%2A> property to `true`.
The value of this property is stored in viewstate.
`true` if the first-page button is displayed in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField"></xref> object; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the last-page button is displayed in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField"></xref> object.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.ShowLastPageButton%2A> property to show or hide the last-page button of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField> object.
To show the last-page button, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.ShowLastPageButton%2A> property to `true`.
The value of this property is stored in viewstate.
`true` if the last-page button is displayed in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField"></xref> object; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the next-page button is displayed in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField"></xref> object.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.ShowNextPageButton%2A> property to show or hide the next-page button of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField> object.
The value of this property is stored in viewstate.
`true` if the next-page button is displayed in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField"></xref> object; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the previous-page button is displayed in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField"></xref> object.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.ShowPreviousPageButton%2A> property to show or hide the previous-page button of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField> object.
The value of this property is stored in viewstate.
`true` if the previous-page button is displayed in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField"></xref> object; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
